title: METHODS OF PROTEIN PURIFICATION AND DOWNSTREAM PROCESSING
description:
(3 Credits)
This course provides a detailed hands-on survey
 of state-of-the-art methods employed by the 
biotechnology industry for the purification of 
products, proteins in particular, from fermentation
 processes. Focus is on methods that offer the
 best potential for scale-up. Included is the theory 
of the design, as well as the operation of these 
methods both at the laboratory scale and scaled 
up. It is intended for biology, biotechnology,
 chemical engineering and biochemistry students. 
(Prerequisite: knowledge of basic biochemistry is
 assumed.)
